title: Chondrogenic Differentiation Induction of Adipose-derived Stem Cells by Centrifugal Gravity
procedures:
This study protocol was approved by the institutional review board of The Catholic University of Korea (KC16EAME0162) and performed according to NIH guidelines. All tissues were obtained with written informed consent.
1. Centrifugal Gravity Loading and Pellet Culture
Cell culture and harvest
	
Culture ASCs (P2-P3; see List of Materials) in Dulbecco's Modified Eagle's Medium-low glucose (DMEM-LG) supplemented with 10% fetal bovine serum (FBS) and 1% penicillin/streptomycin (P/S) at 37 °C in a humidified incubator containing 5% CO2.
When the cells reach 80% confluence, discard the medium and wash the cells with 5 mL of 1x phosphate-buffered saline (PBS).
Add 1 mL of PBS containing 1 mM EDTA and incubate for 2 min at 37 °C in a humidified incubator containing 5% CO2.
Tap the culture plate gently, add 4 mL of fresh medium, transfer the cells to a 15-mL conical tube, and centrifuge the cells at 250 × g for 2 min at room temperature (RT).
Centrifugal gravity loading
	
After centrifugation (step 1.1.4), remove the supernatant without disturbing the pellet and resuspend the pellet in 10 mL of DMEM-LG with 10% FBS. Count the cells using a hemocytometer.
For CG loading, transfer 2.5 × 105 cells to a new 15-mL conical tube and centrifuge at 2,400 × g for 15 min.
Pellet culture
	
Immediately after centrifugation, aspirate the supernatant and add 500 µL of defined chondrogenic differentiation medium (CDM, high-glucose DMEM supplemented with 1% FBS, 1% ITS+Premix, 100 nM dexamethasone, 1x MEM non-essential amino acid solution, 50 µg/mL L-proline, and 1% penicillin/streptomycin). Add 50 µg/mL of freshly prepared L-ascorbic acid 2-phosphate at every medium change. As a positive control, induce chondrogenic differentiation in uncentrifuged cells by adding CDM containing 10 ng/mL TGF-β1.

Place the loosely capped tubes containing the pellets in a standing position and incubate at 37 °C in a humidified incubator containing 5% CO2.
Change the medium every other day for 3 weeks.
Micromass culture
	
Immediately after centrifugation (step 1.2.2; 2,400 × g for 15 min), aspirate the supernatant and resuspend the pellet in 10 µL of CDM.
To form a micromass, place the resuspended cells in the center of a well of a 24-well plate.
After 2 h, carefully add 1 mL of CDM to the well, pipetting against the wall of the plate to avoid disrupting the micromass. As a positive control, perform a micromass culture with uncentrifuged cells by adding CDM containing 10 ng/mL TGF-β1.
Incubate the micromass at 37 °C in a humidified incubator containing 5% CO2.
Change the medium every other day for 3 weeks.
2. Reverse Transcriptase–Polymerase Chain Reaction (RT-PCR) to Detect Transcriptional Upregulation of Chondrogenic Differentiation Markers
On day 14, use a pipette to transfer the spheroid pellets to a new 1.5-mL tube and wash them in 1x PBS.
Extract the total RNA from the pellets using the guanidinium thiocyanate-phenol-chloroform extraction method9.
Synthesize cDNA from 2 µg of total RNA using reverse transcriptase according to the manufacturer's protocol (incubate at 42 °C for 1 h and then inactivate the enzyme at 70 °C for 5 min).
Perform PCR with primers specific for chondrogenic differentiation markers10.
3. Staining to Detect the Overexpression of Chondrogenic Differentiation Marker Proteins
Paraffin-embedding cell pellets
	
On day 21, use a pipette to harvest the spheroid pellets and wash them with 1x PBS.
Fix the spheroid pellets by immersion in 4% paraformaldehyde for 24 h.
		Caution: Paraformaldehyde is highly toxic. Avoid contact with eyes, skin, or mucous membranes. Minimize exposure and avoid inhalation during preparation. Wear appropriate personal protective equipment.

Discard the fixative and rinse the cell pellets with deionized water (DW).
Place one layer of gauze onto the cassette and transfer the fixed pellets using a pipette. Cover the pellet by folding the gauze and close the cassette lid.
Dehydrate the pellets.
		
Immerse the pellets in 70% ethanol (EtOH) for 5 min at RT.
Immerse the pellets in 80% EtOH for 5 min at RT.
Immerse the pellets in 95% EtOH for 5 min at RT.
Immerse the pellets in 100% EtOH for 5 min at RT. Repeat twice.
Immerse the pellets in 100% xylene for 15 min at RT. Repeat twice.
Embed the fixed cell pellets in paraffin at 56 °C in a mold; the pellets can be embedded into paraffin using specialized automated tissue processing systems.
Cut 5 µm-thick sections from the paraffin-embedded cell pellet using a rotary microtome.
Float the sections in 50% EtOH and then transfer them to a 50 °C water bath using a slide.
Place the floating sections onto slides.
Safranin O and Alcian blue staining
	
Rehydrate the paraffin sections.
		
Immerse the slides in xylene for 15 min. Repeat twice.
Immerse the slides in 100% EtOH for 5 min. Repeat twice.
Immerse the slides in 90% EtOH for 5 min.
Immerse the slides in 80% EtOH for 5 min.
Immerse the slides in 70% EtOH for 5 min, and then wash them in 1x PBS.
Stain the rehydrated sections with 1% Safranin O solution and 3% Alcian blue for 30 min.
Discard the staining solution and rinse the sections with DW.
Stain the sections with Hematoxylin/Eosin solution (counterstain) for 1 min.
Discard the staining solution and rinse the sections with DW.

Place a drop of mounting medium on a coverslip after removing any residual water. Carefully place the slide (cell-side down) on the coverslip containing the mounting medium.
Allow the slides to dry for 2-3 h at RT.
Capture images using a bright-field microscope (automated upright microscope, 50X and 200X).
Immunofluorescence assay
	
Rehydrate the sections as described in section 3.2.1.
Immerse the slides in sodium citrate buffer (10 mM sodium citrate, 0.05% Tween 20, pH 6.0), and then maintain them at a sub-boiling temperature for 10 min using a microwave.
Cool the slides for 20 min at RT and then wash them with tap water.
Incubate the slides in 3% H2O2 (in 1x PBS) for 15 min, and then wash them with tap water for 15 min11.
Block the slides with blocking buffer (10% normal goat serum in PBS) for 1 h.
Aspirate the blocking solution, and then apply a primary antibody diluted with 5% normal goat serum onto the slides.
Incubate the slides overnight at 4 °C.
Wash the slides three times in 1x PBS for 5 min each.
Incubate the slides in fluorochrome-conjugated secondary antibody diluted with 5% normal goat serum for 1 h at RT in the dark.
Wash the slides three times in 1x PBS for 5 min each in the dark.
Incubate the slides with DAPI (1 µg/mL) for 10 min, and then wash them two times in 1x PBS for 5 min each.
Place a drop of mounting medium on a coverslip after removing any residual water. Carefully place the slide (cell-side down) on the mounting medium.
Allow the slides to dry for 2-3 h in the dark at RT.
Visualize the slides using fluorescence microscopy (Rhod: 594 nm, DAPI: 340 nm; 60X and 200X magnification)12.
